mastitis.name: Mastitis
mastitis.symptoms: Swollen/hot udder, abnormal milk, fever, reduced yield
mastitis.treatmentAtFarm: Clean udder, frequent milking, apply warm compresses, consult vet for antibiotics.
mastitis.precautions: Maintain clean housing, proper milking hygiene, isolate affected animals.

fmd.name: Foot-and-Mouth Disease (FMD)
fmd.symptoms: Fever, blisters on mouth/feet/teats, salivation, lameness, sudden drop in milk
fmd.treatmentAtFarm: Isolate affected animals, supportive care (fluids, soft food), strict biosecurity.
fmd.precautions: Control movement, disinfect pens, report to local animal health authorities.

bloat.name: Bloat (Ruminal tympany)
bloat.short: Gas accumulation in rumen — can be life threatening
bloat.symptoms: Swelling on left flank, discomfort, difficulty breathing
bloat.treatmentAtFarm: Move animal to stand, pass an ororuminal tube if trained, give anti-foaming agents (poloxalene).
bloat.precautions: Avoid sudden diet changes, limit access to lush legumes, feed slowly.

lsd.name: Lumpy Skin Disease (LSD)
lsd.symptoms: Skin lumps, fever, decreased appetite, decreased milk, sometimes eye/nasal discharge
lsd.treatmentAtFarm: Supportive care, isolate affected animals, control insect vectors, contact vet for specific care.
lsd.precautions: Vector control, vaccination where available, isolate and report outbreaks.

parasitic.name: Parasitic Infestation (Ticks / Internal worms)
parasitic.short: External and internal parasites affecting general health
parasitic.symptoms: Poor condition, anemia, itching (ticks), diarrhoea/weight loss (worms)
parasitic.treatmentAtFarm: Regular deworming schedule, topical tick control, maintain clean environment.
parasitic.precautions: Follow recommended deworming programs, pasture rotation, tick control measures.

brucellosis.name: Brucellosis
brucellosis.treatmentAtFarm: Not treatable on farm; infected animals often need veterinary assessment and herd testing.
brucellosis.precautions: Practice safe handling, test-and-slaughter policies may apply, maintain biosecurity.
